original: Katamo ca puggalo nirāso?
analyzed: katamaḥ ca puggalaḥ nirāsaḥ

original: Idhekacco puggalo dussīlo hoti pāpadhammo asuci saṅkassarasamācāro paṭicchannakammanto assamaṇo samaṇapaṭiñño abrahmacārī brahmacāripaṭiñño antopūti avassuto kasambujāto.
analyzed: idha ekaccaḥ puggalaḥ dussīlaḥ hoti pāpa dhammaḥ asuci saṅkassara samācāraḥ paṭicchanna kammantaḥ a ssamaṇaḥ samaṇa paṭiññaḥ abrahmacārī brahmacāri paṭiññaḥ antopūti avassutaḥ kasambu jātaḥ
translated: It’s the person who is unvirtuous, of bad character, impure, of suspect behavior, secretive in his actions, not an ascetic, not a brāhmaṇa, though claiming to be one, not living the spiritual life, though claiming to be doing so, rotten inside, polluted, and degenerate.

original: So suṇāti—
analyzed: saḥ suṇāti
translated: He hears that:

original: “itthannāmo kira bhikkhu āsavānaṁ khayā anāsavaṁ cetovimuttiṁ paññāvimuttiṁ diṭṭheva dhamme sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharatī”ti.
analyzed: itthannāmaḥ kira bhikkhu āsavānam khayā anāsavam cetaḥ vimuttim paññā vimuttim diṭṭhe iva dhamme sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharati iti
translated: “It seems the monk named so-and-so, by the ending of the effluents, has entered & remains in the effluent-free awareness-release & discernment-release, directly knowing & realizing it for himself right in the here-&-now.”

original: Tassa na evaṁ hoti—
analyzed: tassa na evam hoti
translated: He doesn’t think,

original: “kudāssu nāmāhampi āsavānaṁ khayā anāsavaṁ cetovimuttiṁ paññāvimuttiṁ diṭṭheva dhamme sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharissāmī”ti.
analyzed: kudāssu nāma aham pi āsavānam khayā anāsavam cetaḥ vimuttim paññā vimuttim diṭṭhe iva dhamme sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharissāmi iti
translated: “When, by the ending of the effluents, will I enter & remain in the effluent-free awareness-release & discernment-release, directly knowing & realizing it for myself right in the here-&-now?”

original: Ayaṁ vuccati puggalo “nirāso”.
analyzed: ayam vuccati puggalaḥ nirāsaḥ
translated: This is called the person who is without hope.

original: Katamo ca puggalo āsaṁso?
analyzed: katamaḥ ca puggalaḥ āsasaḥ
translated: And what is the person who is hopeful?

original: Idhekacco puggalo sīlavā hoti kalyāṇadhammo.
analyzed: idha ekaccaḥ puggalo sīlavā hoti kalyāṇa dhammo
translated: It’s the person who is virtuous, of good character.

original: So suṇāti—
analyzed: saḥ suṇāti
translated: He hears that:

original: “itthannāmo kira bhikkhu āsavānaṁ khayā anāsavaṁ cetovimuttiṁ paññāvimuttiṁ diṭṭheva dhamme sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharatī”ti.
analyzed: itthannāmaḥ kira bhikkhu āsavānam khayā anāsavam cetaḥ vimuttim paññā vimuttim diṭṭhe iva dhamme sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharati iti
translated: ‘It seems the monk so-and-so has realized the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life, and lives having realized it with his own insight due to the ending of defilements.’

original: Tassa evaṁ hoti—
analyzed: tassa evam hoti
translated: He thinks:

original: “kudāssu nāmāhampi āsavānaṁ khayā anāsavaṁ cetovimuttiṁ paññāvimuttiṁ diṭṭheva dhamme sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharissāmī”ti.
analyzed: kudāssu nāma aham pi āsavānam khayā anāsavam cetaḥ vimuttim paññā vimuttim diṭṭhe iva dhamme sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharissāmi iti
translated: ‘When will I realize the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life, and live having realized it with my own insight due to the ending of defilements?’

original: Ayaṁ vuccati puggalo “āsaṁso”.
analyzed: ayam vuccati puggalaḥ āsasaḥ
translated: This is called a person who is hopeful.

original: Katamo ca puggalo vigatāso?
analyzed: katamo ca puggalo vigata aso
translated: And what is a person who is free from hope?

original: Idhekacco puggalo āsavānaṁ khayā anāsavaṁ cetovimuttiṁ paññāvimuttiṁ diṭṭheva dhamme sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharati.
analyzed: idha ekaccaḥ puggalaḥ āsavānam khayā anāsavam cetaḥ vimuttim paññā vimuttim diṭṭhe iva dhamme sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharati
translated: It’s a person who has realized the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life, and lives having realized it with his own insight due to the ending of defilements.

original: So suṇāti—
analyzed: saḥ suṇāti
translated: He hears:

original: “itthannāmo kira bhikkhu āsavānaṁ khayā anāsavaṁ cetovimuttiṁ paññāvimuttiṁ diṭṭheva dhamme sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharatī”ti.
analyzed: itthannāmaḥ kira bhikkhu āsavānam khayā anāsavam cetaḥ vimuttim paññā vimuttim diṭṭhe iva dhamme sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharati iti
translated: ‘It seems the monk so-and-so has realized the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life, and lives having realized it with his own insight due to the ending of defilements.’

original: Tassa na evaṁ hoti—
analyzed: tassa na evam hoti
translated: He doesn’t think:

original: “kudāssu nāmāhampi āsavānaṁ khayā anāsavaṁ cetovimuttiṁ paññāvimuttiṁ diṭṭheva dhamme sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharissāmī”ti.
analyzed: kudāssu nāma aham pi āsavānam khayā anāsavam cetaḥ vimuttim paññā vimuttim diṭṭhe iva dhamme sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharissāmi iti
translated: ‘When shall I enter & remain in the release of awareness where there is no fuel left for the fires of passion, aversion, & delusion?’

original: Taṁ kissa hetu?
analyzed: tam kim sa hetu
translated: Why is that?

original: Yā hissa pubbe avimuttassa vimuttāsā, sā paṭippassaddhā.
analyzed: yā hi ssa pubbe a vimuttassa sā paṭippassaddhā
translated: Because the desire for release that was previously in him has now subsided.

original: Ayaṁ vuccati puggalo “vigatāso”.🔽Tattha katame tayo gilānūpamā puggalā?
analyzed: ayam vuccati puggalo vigata aso  tattha katame tayaḥ gilāna upamā puggalā
translated: This is called a person without passion.

original: Tayo gilānā—
analyzed: tayaḥ gilānā
translated: • “Three sick persons:

original: idhekacco gilāno labhanto vā sappāyāni bhojanāni alabhanto vā sappāyāni bhojanāni,
analyzed: idha ekaccaḥ gilānaḥ labhantaḥ vā sappāyāni bhojanāni a labhantaḥ vā sappāyāni bhojanāni
translated: There is the case, friends, where a certain person is sick, not getting the right kind of food or medicine or nurses or the right conditions.🔽He doesn’t recover from that illness.

original: labhanto vā sappāyāni bhesajjāni alabhanto vā sappāyāni bhesajjāni, labhanto vā patirūpaṁ
analyzed: labhantaḥ vā sappāyāni bhesajjāni a labhantaḥ vā sappāyāni bhesajjāni labhantaḥ vā patirūpa
translated: There is the case where a certain person is sick, getting the right kind of food or medicine or nurses or the right conditions.

original: upaṭṭhākaṁ alabhanto vā patirūpaṁ upaṭṭhākaṁ, neva vuṭṭhāti tamhā ābādhā.
analyzed: upaṭṭhākam a labhantaḥ vā patirūpam upaṭṭhāka na iva vuṭṭhāti tamhā ābādhā
translated: He doesn’t recover from that illness.

original: Idha panekacco gilāno labhanto vā sappāyāni bhojanāni alabhanto vā sappāyāni bhojanāni,
analyzed: idha pana ekaccaḥ gilānaḥ labhantaḥ vā sappāyāni bhojanāni a labhantaḥ vā sappāyāni bhojanāni
translated: There is the case where a certain person is sick, getting the right kind of food or medicine or nurses or the right conditions.🔽He recovers from that illness.

original: labhanto vā sappāyāni bhesajjāni alabhanto vā sappāyāni bhesajjāni, labhanto vā patirūpaṁ
analyzed: labhantaḥ vā sappāyāni bhesajjāni a labhantaḥ vā sappāyāni bhesajjāni labhantaḥ vā patirūpa
translated: whether he gets suitable medicine or not,

original: upaṭṭhākaṁ alabhanto vā patirūpaṁ upaṭṭhākaṁ, vuṭṭhāti tamhā ābādhā.🔽Idha panekacco gilāno labhanto sappāyāni bhojanāni no alabhanto, labhanto sappāyāni bhesajjāni no alabhanto, labhanto patirūpaṁ upaṭṭhākaṁ no alabhanto, vuṭṭhāti tamhā ābādhā.
analyzed: upaṭṭhākam a labhantaḥ vā patirūpam upaṭṭhāka vuṭṭhāti tamhā ābādhā  idha pana ekaccaḥ gilānaḥ labhantaḥ sappāyāni bhojanāni no a labhantaḥ labhantaḥ sappāyāni bhesajjāni no a labhantaḥ labhantaḥ patirūpam upaṭṭhākam no a labhantaḥ vuṭṭhāti tamhā ābādhā
translated: whether he gets a suitable attendant or not, he recovers from that affliction.

original: Tatra yvāyaṁ gilāno labhanto sappāyāni bhojanāni no alabhanto, labhanto sappāyāni
analyzed: tatra yvā ayam gilānaḥ labhantaḥ sappāyāni bhojanāni no a labhantaḥ labhantaḥ sappāyāni
translated: Here, one who is sick gets suitable food, not unsuitable food,🔽gets suitable medicine, not unsuitable medicine,

original: bhesajjāni no alabhanto, labhanto patirūpaṁ upaṭṭhākaṁ no alabhanto, vuṭṭhāti tamhā
analyzed: bhesajjāni no a labhantaḥ labhantaḥ patirūpam upaṭṭhākam no a labhantaḥ vuṭṭhāti tamhā
translated: gets a suitable attendant, not an unsuitable attendant, and he recovers from that affliction.

original: ābādhā, imaṁ gilānaṁ paṭicca bhagavatā gilānabhattaṁ anuññātaṁ gilānabhesajjaṁ anuññātaṁ
analyzed: ābādhāḥ imam gilānam paṭicca bhagavatā gilāna bhattam anuññātam gilāna bhesajjam anuññāta
translated: Herein, the Blessed One has allowed the sick-room allowance, the medicine allowance,🔽and the attendant allowance for the sick person who gets suitable food, not unsuitable food,

original: gilānupaṭṭhāko anuññāto.
analyzed: gilānupaṭṭhākaḥ anuññāto
translated: who gets suitable medicine, not unsuitable medicine,🔽who gets a suitable attendant, not an unsuitable attendant, and who recovers from that affliction.

original: Imañca pana gilānaṁ paṭicca aññepi gilānā upaṭṭhātabbā.
analyzed: imam ca pana gilānam paṭicca aññe pi gilānāḥ upaṭṭhātabbā
translated: And because of this sick person, others should be attended on when sick.

original: Evamevaṁ tayo gilānūpamā puggalā santo saṁvijjamānā lokasmiṁ.
analyzed: evam evam tayaḥ gilāna upamā puggalā santaḥ sa vijjamānā lokasmi
translated: “So too, there are these three kinds of persons similar to the sick found in the world.

original: Katame tayo?
analyzed: katame tayaḥ
translated: What three?

original: Idhekacco puggalo labhanto vā tathāgataṁ dassanāya alabhanto vā tathāgataṁ dassanāya,🔽labhanto vā tathāgatappaveditaṁ dhammavinayaṁ savaṇāya alabhanto vā tathāgatappaveditaṁ
analyzed: idha ekaccaḥ puggalaḥ labhantaḥ vā tathāgatam dassanāya a labhantaḥ vā tathāgatam dassanāya  labhantaḥ vā tathāgata paveditam dhamma vinayam savaṇāya a labhantaḥ vā tathāgata pavedita
translated: “There is the case where a person, whether getting to see the Tathāgata or not,🔽whether getting to hear the Tathāgata’s Dhamma or not,

original: dhammavinayaṁ savaṇāya, neva okkamati niyāmaṁ kusalesu dhammesu sammattaṁ.
analyzed: dhamma vinayam savaṇāya na iva okkamati niyāmam kusalesu dhammesu
translated: does not enter & remain in the right way in terms of skillful qualities.

original: Idha panekacco puggalo labhanto vā tathāgataṁ dassanāya alabhanto vā tathāgataṁ dassanāya,🔽labhanto vā tathāgatappaveditaṁ dhammavinayaṁ savaṇāya alabhanto vā tathāgatappaveditaṁ
analyzed: idha pana ekaccaḥ puggalo labhantaḥ vā tathāgatam dassanāya a labhantaḥ vā tathāgatam dassanāya  labhantaḥ vā tathāgata paveditam dhamma vinayam savaṇāya a labhantaḥ vā tathāgata pavedita
translated: “There is the case where a person, whether getting to see the Tathāgata or not,🔽whether getting to hear the Tathāgata’s Dhamma or not,

original: dhammavinayaṁ savaṇāya, okkamati niyāmaṁ kusalesu dhammesu sammattaṁ.
analyzed: dhamma vinayam savaṇāya okkamati niyāmam kusalesu dhammesu
translated: enters & remains in the right way in terms of skillful qualities.

original: Idha panekacco puggalo labhanto tathāgataṁ dassanāya no alabhanto, labhanto tathāgatappaveditaṁ dhammavinayaṁ savaṇāya no alabhanto, okkamati niyāmaṁ kusalesu dhammesu sammattaṁ.🔽Tatra yvāyaṁ puggalo labhanto tathāgataṁ dassanāya no alabhanto, labhanto tathāgatappaveditaṁ
analyzed: idha pana ekaccaḥ puggalaḥ labhantaḥ tathāgatam dassanāya no a labhantaḥ labhantaḥ tathāgata ppaveditam dhamma vinayam savaṇāya no a labhantaḥ okkamati niyāmam kusalesu dhammesu  tatra yvā ayam puggalaḥ labhantaḥ tathāgatam dassanāya no a labhantaḥ labhantaḥ tathāgata ppavedita
translated: “Here, someone, not getting to see the Tathagata, not getting to hear the Tathagata-taught Dhamma-Vinaya, enters upon the certainty that is rightness in wholesome qualities.

original: dhammavinayaṁ savaṇāya no alabhanto, okkamati niyāmaṁ kusalesu dhammesu sammattaṁ,
analyzed: dhamma vinayam savaṇāya no a labhantaḥ okkamati niyāmam kusalesu dhammesu
translated: “Therein, the person who, not getting to see the Tathagata, not getting to hear the Tathagata-taught Dhamma-Vinaya, enters upon the certainty that is rightness in wholesome qualities

original: imaṁ puggalaṁ paṭicca bhagavatā dhammadesanā anuññātā, imañca puggalaṁ paṭicca aññesampi dhammo desetabbo.
analyzed: imam puggalam paṭicca bhagavatā dhamma desanā anuññātā imam ca puggalam paṭicca aññesam pi dhammo desetabbo
translated: is the person on account of whom the Blessed One has allowed the teaching of the Dhamma. And it is on account of this person that the Dhamma should be taught to others.

original: Ime tayo gilānūpamā puggalā santo saṁvijjamānā lokasmiṁ.
analyzed: ime tayaḥ gilāna upamā puggalā santaḥ sa vijjamānā lokasmi
translated: “These are the three kinds of persons comparable to the sick found existing in the world.

original: Katamo ca puggalo kāyasakkhī?
analyzed: katamaḥ ca puggalo kāya sakkhī
translated: “And what kind of person is a body-witness?

original: Idhekacco puggalo aṭṭha vimokkhe kāyena phusitvā viharati, paññāya cassa disvā ekacce āsavā parikkhīṇā honti—
analyzed: idha ekaccaḥ puggalaḥ aṭṭha vimokkhe kāyena phusitvā viharati paññāya ca ssa disvā ekacce āsavā parikkhīṇāḥ honti
translated: “Here, someone has experienced the eight emancipations with the body and seen with wisdom that there is nothing further beyond these emancipations.

original: ayaṁ vuccati puggalo “kāyasakkhī”.
analyzed: ayam vuccati puggalo kāya sakkhī
translated: This kind of person is called a body-witness.

original: Katamo ca puggalo diṭṭhippatto?🔽Idhekacco puggalo “idaṁ dukkhan”ti yathābhūtaṁ pajānāti, “ayaṁ dukkhasamudayo”ti
analyzed: katamaḥ ca puggalo diṭṭhi ppatto  idha ekaccaḥ puggalaḥ idam dukkhanti yathābhūtam pajānāti ayam dukkha samudayaḥ ti
translated: “And what kind of person has attained to view?

original: yathābhūtaṁ pajānāti, “ayaṁ dukkhanirodho”ti yathābhūtaṁ pajānāti, “ayaṁ dukkhanirodhagāminī
analyzed: yathābhūtam pajānāti ayam dukkha nirodhaḥ iti yathābhūtam pajānāti ayam dukkha nirodha gāminī
translated: There is the case where a person discerns, as it actually is, that ‘This is stress… This is the origination of stress… This is the cessation of stress… This is the way leading to the cessation of stress.

original: paṭipadā”ti yathābhūtaṁ pajānāti, tathāgatappaveditā cassa dhammā paññāya vodiṭṭhā
analyzed: paṭipadā ti yathābhūtam pajānāti tathāgata ppaveditā ca assa dhammā paññāya vodiṭṭhā
translated: The Dhamma is well-proclaimed by the Tathagata—inwardly experienced, not concocted by reasoning, seen rightly by the wise for themselves.

original: honti vocaritā, paññāya cassa disvā ekacce āsavā parikkhīṇā honti—
analyzed: honti vocaritā paññāya ca ssa disvā ekacce āsavā parikkhīṇā honti
translated: And he has, by means of direct knowledge, fully realized it.

original: ayaṁ vuccati puggalo “diṭṭhippatto”.
analyzed: ayam vuccati puggalo diṭṭhi ppatto
translated: This is called a person who has attained to view.

original: Katamo ca puggalo saddhāvimutto?
analyzed: katamaḥ ca puggalaḥ saddhā vimuttaḥ
translated: “And what kind of person is freed in terms of conviction?

original: Idhekacco puggalo “idaṁ dukkhan”ti yathābhūtaṁ pajānāti …pe…
analyzed: idha ekaccaḥ puggalaḥ idam dukkhan ti yathābhūtam pajānāti pe
translated: There is the case where a person discerns, as it actually is, that ‘This is stress… This is the origination of stress… This is the cessation of stress… This is the way leading to the cessation of stress.🔽The Dhamma is well-proclaimed by the Tathagata—inwardly experienced, not concocted by reasoning, seen rightly by the wise for themselves.

original: tathāgatappaveditā cassa dhammā paññāya vodiṭṭhā honti vocaritā, paññāya cassa disvā ekacce āsavā parikkhīṇā honti, no ca kho yathādiṭṭhippattassa—
analyzed: tathāgata ppaveditā cassa dhammā paññāya vodiṭṭhāḥ honti vocaritā paññāya cassa disvā ekacce āsavā parikkhīṇāḥ honti no ca kho yathā diṭṭhi ppattassa
translated: And he has, by means of direct knowledge, fully realized it. But he has not attained to the ending of the effluents, as in the case of the person who has attained to view.

original: ayaṁ vuccati puggalo “saddhāvimutto”.
analyzed: ayam vuccati puggalo saddhā vimutto
translated: This is called a person who is freed in terms of conviction.

original: Katamo ca puggalo gūthabhāṇī?
analyzed: katamaḥ ca puggalaḥ gūtha bhāṇī
translated: “Who is the person who speaks what is contrary to the Dhamma as if it were the Dhamma?🔽“There is the case where a certain person is a liar. He is one who, in order to lay down or to take up, in order to pick up or to throw away, in order to say or to let be, speaks untruth.

original: Idhekacco puggalo musāvādī hoti sabhaggato vā parisaggato vā ñātimajjhagato vā pūgamajjhagato vā rājakulamajjhagato vā abhinīto sakkhipuṭṭho—
analyzed: idha ekaccaḥ puggalaḥ musā vādī hoti sabhaggataḥ vā parisaggataḥ vā ñāti majjha gataḥ vā pūga majjha gataḥ vā rāja kula majjha gataḥ vā abhinītaḥ sakkhipuṭṭhaḥ
translated: He is brought before the King on a charge,🔽and the King’s men arrest him, bind him, and bring him before the King, saying,

original: “ehambho, purisa, yaṁ jānāsi taṁ vadehī”ti,🔽so ajānaṁ vā āha—“jānāmī”ti,🔽jānaṁ vā āha—“na jānāmī”ti,
analyzed: eham bho purisa yam jānāsi tam vadehi iti  saḥ ajānam vai āha jānāmi iti  jānam vai āhana jānāmi iti
translated: ‘Your Majesty, this man is a liar.

original: apassaṁ vā āha—“passāmī”ti,
analyzed: apassam vai āha passāmi iti
translated: He is one who, in order to lay down or to take up, in order to pick up or to throw away, in order to say or to let be, speaks untruth.’

original: passaṁ vā āha—“na passāmī”ti.
analyzed: passam vai āhana passāmi iti
translated: “The King says to him, ‘My good man, you are a liar.

original: Iti attahetu vā parahetu vā āmisakiñcikkhahetu vā sampajānamusā bhāsitā hoti—
analyzed: iti atta hetu vā para hetu vā āmisa kiñcikkha hetu vā sampajāna musā bhāsitā hoti
translated: You are one who, in order to lay down or to take up, in order to pick up or to throw away, in order to say or to let be, speaks untruth.’🔽“The King, having had him flogged with a sharp whip, has him thrown in jail, saying,🔽‘Keep this man in jail until his skin dries up and his bones disintegrate.’

original: ayaṁ vuccati puggalo “gūthabhāṇī”.
analyzed: ayam vuccati puggalaḥ gūtha bhāṇī
translated: “This is called a person who speaks what is contrary to the Dhamma as if it were the Dhamma.

original: Katamo ca puggalo pupphabhāṇī?
analyzed: katamaḥ ca puggalo puppha bhāṇī
translated: “Who is the person who speaks what is contrary to the Dhamma as if it were the Dhamma?🔽“There is the case where a certain person, abandoning false speech, abstains from false speech.🔽He is one who, in order to lay down or to take up, in order to pick up or to throw away, in order to say or to let be, speaks truth.

original: Idhekacco puggalo musāvādaṁ pahāya musāvādā paṭivirato hoti sabhaggato vā parisaggato vā ñātimajjhagato vā pūgamajjhagato vā rājakulamajjhagato vā abhinīto sakkhipuṭṭho—🔽“ehambho, purisa, yaṁ jānāsi taṁ vadehī”ti,
analyzed: idha ekaccaḥ puggalaḥ musāvādam pahāya musāvādā paṭivirataḥ hoti sabhaggataḥ vā parisaggataḥ vā ñāti majjha gataḥ vā pūga majjha gataḥ vā rāja kula majjha gataḥ vā abhinītaḥ sakkhipuṭṭhaḥ 🔽eham bho purisa yam jānāsi tam vadehi iti
translated: He is brought before the King on a charge,

original: so ajānaṁ vā āha—“na jānāmī”ti,
analyzed: saḥ ajānam vai āhana jānāmi iti
translated: When he doesn’t know, he says, ‘I don’t know.’

original: jānaṁ vā āha—“jānāmī”ti,
analyzed: jānam vai āha jānāmi iti
translated: When he knows, he says, ‘I know.’

original: apassaṁ vā āha—“na passāmī”ti,
analyzed: a passam vai āhana passāmi iti
translated: When he hasn’t seen, he says, ‘I haven’t seen.’

original: passaṁ vā āha—“passāmī”ti.
analyzed: passam vai āha passāmi iti
translated: When he has seen, he says, ‘I have seen.’

original: Iti attahetu vā parahetu vā āmisakiñcikkhahetu vā na sampajānamusā bhāsitā hoti—
analyzed: iti atta hetu vā para hetu vā āmisa kiñcikkha hetu vā na sampajāna musā bhāsitā hoti
translated: So he doesn’t speak falsehood for his own sake, for the sake of another, or for the sake of any reward.

original: ayaṁ vuccati puggalo “pupphabhāṇī”.
analyzed: ayam vuccati puggalo puppha bhāṇī
translated: This is called a person who speaks like a flower.

original: Katamo ca puggalo madhubhāṇī?
analyzed: katamaḥ ca puggalaḥ madhu bhāṇī
translated: And what is a person who speaks like honey?

original: Idhekacco puggalo yā sā vācā nelā kaṇṇasukhā pemanīyā hadayaṅgamā porī bahujanakantā bahujanamanāpā, tathārūpiṁ vācaṁ bhāsitā hoti—
analyzed: idha ekaccaḥ puggalaḥ yā sā vācā na ilā kaṇṇa sukhā pemanīyā hadayaṅgamā porī bahu jana kantā bahu jana manāpā tathārūpim vācam bhāsitā hoti
translated: It’s a person who speaks in a way that is refined, pleasant to the ear, and loveable, that enters the mind and pleases the heart, is polite, appealing, and pleasing to many people.

original: ayaṁ vuccati puggalo “madhubhāṇī”.
analyzed: ayam vuccati puggalaḥ madhu bhāṇī
translated: This is called a person who speaks like honey.

original: Katamo ca puggalo arukūpamacitto?
analyzed: katamaḥ ca puggalaḥ arukū pama cittaḥ
translated: And what is a person with a mind like a wound?

original: Idhekacco puggalo kodhano hoti upāyāsabahulo, appampi vutto samāno abhisajjati kuppati byāpajjati patitthīyati, kopañca dosañca appaccayañca pātukaroti.
analyzed: idha ekaccaḥ puggalaḥ kodhanaḥ hoti upāyāsa bahulaḥ appampi vutto samānaḥ abhisajjati kuppati byāpajjati patitthīyati kopam ca dosañca appaccayañca pātukaroti
translated: It’s a person who is irritable and resentful, who is easily angered and slow to be appeased. When spoken to about anything at all, he gets angry, hostile, and resentful, and shows anger, hate, and bitterness.

original: Seyyathāpi nāma duṭṭhāruko kaṭṭhena vā kaṭhalāya vā ghaṭṭito bhiyyoso mattāya āsavaṁ deti;
analyzed: seyyathā api nāma duṭṭha ārukaḥ kaṭṭhena vā kaṭhalāya vā ghaṭṭitaḥ bhiyyosaḥ mattāya āsavam deti
translated: Just as a poisoned arrow, when struck with a stick or a clod, releases even more poison,

original: evamevaṁ idhekacco puggalo kodhano hoti upāyāsabahulo, appampi vutto samāno abhisajjati kuppati byāpajjati patitthīyati, kopañca dosañca appaccayañca pātukaroti—
analyzed: evam evam idha ekaccaḥ puggalaḥ kodhanaḥ hoti upāyāsa bahulaḥ vutto samānaḥ abhisajjati kuppati byāpajjati patitthīyati kopam ca dosañca appaccayañca pātukaroti
translated: so too is this person angry and bad-tempered. When spoken to in a way that is contrary to Dhamma, he is quick-tempered, irritable, and uncouth, and he displays anger, hatred, and bitterness.

original: ayaṁ vuccati puggalo “arukūpamacitto”.
analyzed: ayam vuccati puggalaḥ arukūpamacitto
translated: This is called a person with a mind like a poisoned arrow.

original: Katamo ca puggalo vijjūpamacitto?
analyzed: katamaḥ ca puggalaḥ vijju upama cittaḥ
translated: What kind of person has a mind like lightning?🔽There is the case where a person discerns, as it actually is, that ‘This is suffering.’

original: Idhekacco puggalo “idaṁ dukkhan”ti yathābhūtaṁ pajānāti, “ayaṁ dukkhasamudayo”ti🔽yathābhūtaṁ pajānāti, “ayaṁ dukkhanirodho”ti yathābhūtaṁ pajānāti, “ayaṁ dukkhanirodhagāminī
analyzed: idha ekaccaḥ puggalaḥ idam dukkhanti yathābhūtam pajānāti ayam dukkha samudayaḥ ti  yathābhūtam pajānāti ayam dukkha nirodhaḥ iti yathābhūtam pajānāti ayam dukkha nirodha gāminī
translated: He discerns, as it actually is, that ‘This is the origination of suffering.’🔽He discerns, as it actually is, that ‘This is the cessation of suffering.’

original: paṭipadā”ti yathābhūtaṁ pajānāti.
analyzed: yathābhūtam pajānāti
translated: He discerns, as it actually is, that ‘This is the path of practice leading to the cessation of suffering.’

original: Seyyathāpi nāma cakkhumā puriso rattandhakāratimisāya vijjantarikāya rūpāni passeyya;
analyzed: seyyathā api nāma cakkhumā purisaḥ ratta ndhakāra timisāya vijjantarikāya rūpāni passeyya
translated: Just as a person with good eyesight, in the darkness of the night, would see a firefly when it flickered,

original: evamevaṁ idhekacco puggalo “idaṁ dukkhan”ti yathābhūtaṁ pajānāti, “ayaṁ dukkhasamudayo”ti
analyzed: evam evam idha ekaccaḥ puggalo idam dukkhan ti yathābhūtam pajānāti ayam dukkha samudayaḥ ti
translated: so too, here a certain person understands as it really is: “This is suffering,” “This is the origin of suffering,”

original: yathābhūtaṁ pajānāti, “ayaṁ dukkhanirodho”ti yathābhūtaṁ pajānāti, “ayaṁ dukkhanirodhagāminī🔽paṭipadā”ti yathābhūtaṁ pajānāti—
analyzed: yathābhūtam pajānāti ayam dukkha nirodhaḥ iti yathābhūtam pajānāti ayam dukkha nirodha gāminī  yathābhūtam pajānāti
translated: So too, there is the case where a certain person discerns, as it actually is, that ‘This is stress… This is the origination of stress… This is the cessation of stress… This is the way leading to the cessation of stress.

original: ayaṁ vuccati puggalo “vijjūpamacitto”.
analyzed: ayam vuccati puggalaḥ vijju upama cittaḥ
translated: This is the person I call ‘one with a mind like lightning.’

original: Katamo ca puggalo vajirūpamacitto?
analyzed: katamaḥ ca puggalaḥ vaji rūpam acittaḥ
translated: “And what is the person with a mind like a diamond?

original: Idhekacco puggalo āsavānaṁ khayā anāsavaṁ cetovimuttiṁ paññāvimuttiṁ diṭṭheva dhamme sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharati.
analyzed: idha ekaccaḥ puggalaḥ āsavānam khayā anāsavam cetaḥ vimuttim paññā vimuttim diṭṭhe iva dhamme sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharati
translated: There is the case where a certain person, through the ending of effluents, dwells in the effluent-free awareness-release & discernment-release, directly knowing & realizing it for himself right in the here-&-now.

original: Seyyathāpi nāma vajirassa natthi kiñci abhejjaṁ maṇi vā pāsāṇo vā;
analyzed: seyyathā api nāma vajirassa natthi kiñci abhejjam maṇi vā pāsāṇaḥ vā
translated: Just as there is no gem like a diamond, no gem equal to a diamond,

original: evamevaṁ idhekacco puggalo āsavānaṁ khayā anāsavaṁ cetovimuttiṁ paññāvimuttiṁ diṭṭheva dhamme sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharati—
analyzed: evam evam idha ekaccaḥ puggalaḥ āsavānam khayā anāsavam cetaḥ vimuttim paññā vimuttim diṭṭhe iva dhamme sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharati
translated: so too is there the case where a certain person, through the ending of effluents, dwells in the effluent-free awareness-release & discernment-release, directly knowing & realizing it for himself right in the here-&-now.

original: ayaṁ vuccati puggalo “vajirūpamacitto”.
analyzed: ayam vuccati puggalaḥ vaji rūpam acittaḥ
translated: This is the person I call ‘one with a mind like a diamond.’

original: Katamo ca puggalo andho?
analyzed: katamaḥ ca puggalaḥ andhaḥ
translated: “And what is the blind person?

original: Idhekaccassa puggalassa tathārūpaṁ cakkhu na hoti yathārūpena cakkhunā anadhigataṁ vā bhogaṁ adhigaccheyya, adhigataṁ vā bhogaṁ phātiṁ kareyya;
analyzed: idha ekaccassa puggalassa tathārūpam cakkhu na hoti yathārūpena cakkhunā anadhigatam vā bhogam adhigaccheyya adhigatam vā bhogam phātim kareyya
translated: There is the case where a person does not have the kind of eyesight with which one might acquire wealth that has not been acquired or increase wealth that has been acquired.

original: tathārūpampissa cakkhu na hoti yathārūpena cakkhunā kusalākusale dhamme jāneyya, sāvajjānavajje dhamme jāneyya, hīnappaṇīte dhamme jāneyya, kaṇhasukkasappaṭibhāge dhamme jāneyya—
analyzed: tathārūpam pissa cakkhu na hoti yathārūpena cakkhunā kusala akusale dhamme jāneyya sāvajja anavajje dhamme jāneyya hīna ppaṇīte dhamme jāneyya kaṇha sukka sappaṭibhāge dhamme jāneyya
translated: He does not have the kind of eyesight with which one might discern, in terms of qualities, skillful & unskillful, blameworthy & blameless, mean & noble, or what is rightly gone & wrongly gone.

original: ayaṁ vuccati puggalo “andho”.
analyzed: ayam vuccati puggalaḥ andhaḥ
translated: This is called a person who is blind.

original: Katamo ca puggalo ekacakkhu?
analyzed: katamaḥ ca puggalaḥ eka cakkhu
translated: “And what sort of person is one-eyed?

original: Idhekaccassa puggalassa tathārūpaṁ cakkhu hoti, yathārūpena cakkhunā anadhigataṁ vā bhogaṁ adhigaccheyya, adhigataṁ vā bhogaṁ phātiṁ kareyya;
analyzed: idha ekaccassa puggalassa tathārūpam cakkhu hoti yathārūpena cakkhunā anadhigatam vā bhogam adhigaccheyya adhigatam vā bhogam phātim kareyya
translated: There is the case where a person has the kind of eyesight with which one might acquire wealth that has not been acquired or increase wealth that has been acquired.

original: tathārūpampissa cakkhu na hoti yathārūpena cakkhunā kusalākusale dhamme jāneyya, sāvajjānavajje dhamme jāneyya, hīnappaṇīte dhamme jāneyya, kaṇhasukkasappaṭibhāge dhamme jāneyya—
analyzed: tathārūpam pissa cakkhu na hoti yathārūpena cakkhunā kusala akusale dhamme jāneyya sāvajja anavajje dhamme jāneyya hīna ppaṇīte dhamme jāneyya kaṇha sukka sappaṭibhāge dhamme jāneyya
translated: He does not have the kind of eyes with which he could know wholesome and unwholesome qualities, blameworthy and blameless qualities, inferior and superior qualities, dark and bright qualities with their counterparts.

original: ayaṁ vuccati puggalo “ekacakkhu”.
analyzed: ayam vuccati puggalaḥ eka cakkhu
translated: This kind of person is said to be “one-eyed.”

original: Katamo ca puggalo dvicakkhu?
analyzed: katamaḥ ca puggalaḥ dvi cakkhu
translated: “What kind of person is two-eyed?

original: Idhekaccassa puggalassa tathārūpaṁ cakkhu hoti yathārūpena cakkhunā anadhigataṁ vā bhogaṁ adhigaccheyya, adhigataṁ vā bhogaṁ phātiṁ kareyya;
analyzed: idha ekaccassa puggalassa tathārūpam cakkhu hoti yathārūpena cakkhunā anadhigatam vā bhogam adhigaccheyya adhigatam vā bhogam phātim kareyya
translated: There is the case where a person has the kind of eyes with which he could acquire wealth that he has not yet acquired. He could make his existing wealth increase.

original: tathārūpampissa cakkhu hoti yathārūpena cakkhunā kusalākusale dhamme jāneyya, sāvajjānavajje dhamme jāneyya, hīnappaṇīte dhamme jāneyya, kaṇhasukkasappaṭibhāge dhamme jāneyya—
analyzed: tathārūpam pissa cakkhu hoti yathārūpena cakkhunā kusala akusale dhamme jāneyya sāvajja anavajje dhamme jāneyya hīna ppaṇīte dhamme jāneyya kaṇha sukka sappaṭibhāge dhamme jāneyya
translated: He has the kind of eyes with which he could know wholesome and unwholesome qualities, blameworthy and blameless qualities, inferior and superior qualities, dark and bright qualities with their counterparts.

original: ayaṁ vuccati puggalo “dvicakkhu”.
analyzed: ayam vuccati puggalaḥ dvi cakkhu
translated: This kind of person is said to be “two-eyed.”

original: Katamo ca puggalo avakujjapañño?
analyzed: katamaḥ ca puggalaḥ avakujja pañño
translated: “What kind of person is one who has broken insight?

original: Idhekacco puggalo ārāmaṁ gantā hoti abhikkhaṇaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ santike dhammassavaṇāya.
analyzed: idha ekaccaḥ puggalaḥ ārāmam gantā hoti abhikkhaṇam bhikkhūnam santike dhamma ssavaṇāya
translated: “There is the case where a certain person goes to the monastery again & again to be with the monks & to listen to the Dhamma.

original: Tassa bhikkhū dhammaṁ desenti ādikalyāṇaṁ majjhekalyāṇaṁ pariyosānakalyāṇaṁ sātthaṁ sabyañjanaṁ kevalaparipuṇṇaṁ parisuddhaṁ brahmacariyaṁ pakāsenti.🔽So tasmiṁ āsane nisinno tassā kathāya neva ādiṁ manasi karoti, na majjhaṁ manasi karoti, na pariyosānaṁ manasi karoti.
analyzed: tassa bhikkhū dhammaṃ desenti ādi kalyāṇam majjhe kalyāṇam pariyosāna kalyāṇam sa attham sa byañjanam kevala paripuṇṇam parisuddham brahmacariyam pakāsenti  saḥ tasmim āsane nisinnaḥ tassā kathāya na iva ādim manasi karoti na majjham manasi karoti na pariyosānam manasi karoti
translated: The monks teach him the Dhamma that is good in the beginning, good in the middle, good in the end, with its own meaning, with its own phrasing—the scriptures that are beautiful in their phrasing & meaning.🔽As he sits there, he doesn’t pay attention to the beginning of the Dhamma, doesn’t pay attention to its middle, doesn’t pay attention to its end.

original: Vuṭṭhitopi tamhā āsanā tassā kathāya neva ādiṁ manasi karoti, na majjhaṁ manasi karoti, na pariyosānaṁ manasi karoti.
analyzed: vuṭṭhitaḥ api tamhā āsanā tassā kathāya na iva ādim manasi karoti na majjham manasi karoti na pariyosānam manasi karoti
translated: Even when he gets up from his seat, he doesn’t pay attention to the beginning of the Dhamma, doesn’t pay attention to its middle, doesn’t pay attention to its end.

original: Seyyathāpi nāma kumbho nikkujjo tatra udakaṁ āsittaṁ vivaṭṭati, no saṇṭhāti;
analyzed: seyyathā api nāma kumbhaḥ nikkujjaḥ tatra udakam āsittam vivaṭṭati no saṇṭhāti
translated: Just as if a man were to pour water over the mouth of an overturned pot, and the water would flow out and away, so that one could not say that it had entered the pot,

original: evamevaṁ idhekacco puggalo ārāmaṁ gantā hoti abhikkhaṇaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ santike dhammassavaṇāya.
analyzed: evam evam idha ekaccaḥ puggalaḥ ārāmam gantā hoti abhikkhaṇam bhikkhūnam santike dhamma ssavaṇāya
translated: in the same way, there is the case where a certain person goes to the monastery again & again to be with the monks & to listen to the Dhamma.

original: Tassa bhikkhū dhammaṁ desenti ādikalyāṇaṁ majjhekalyāṇaṁ pariyosānakalyāṇaṁ sātthaṁ sabyañjanaṁ kevalaparipuṇṇaṁ parisuddhaṁ brahmacariyaṁ pakāsenti.🔽So tasmiṁ āsane nisinno tassā kathāya neva ādiṁ manasi karoti, na majjhaṁ manasi karoti, na pariyosānaṁ manasi karoti.
analyzed: tassa bhikkhū dhammaṃ desenti ādi kalyāṇam majjhe kalyāṇam pariyosāna kalyāṇam sa attham sa byañjanam kevala paripuṇṇam parisuddham brahmacariyam pakāsenti  saḥ tasmim āsane nisinnaḥ tassā kathāya na iva ādim manasi karoti na majjham manasi karoti na pariyosānam manasi karoti
translated: The monks teach him the Dhamma good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, with the right meaning and phrasing, and they reveal the holy life that is utterly perfect and pure.🔽But while he is sitting right there, he does not pay attention to the meaning or the Dhamma or the phrasing.

original: Vuṭṭhitopi tamhā āsanā tassā kathāya neva ādiṁ manasi karoti, na majjhaṁ manasi karoti, na pariyosānaṁ manasi karoti—
analyzed: vuṭṭhitaḥ api tamhā āsanā tassā kathāya na iva ādim manasi karoti na majjham manasi karoti na pariyosānam manasi karoti
translated: And when he gets up from his seat, he does not remember the meaning or the Dhamma or the phrasing.

original: ayaṁ vuccati puggalo “avakujjapañño”.
analyzed: ayam vuccati puggalaḥ avakujja pañño
translated: This is called a person with muddled discernment.

original: Katamo ca puggalo ucchaṅgapañño?
analyzed: katamaḥ ca puggalo ucchaṅga pañño
translated: What is a person with discernment on the shoulder?

original: Idhekacco puggalo ārāmaṁ gantā hoti abhikkhaṇaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ santike dhammassavaṇāya.
analyzed: idha ekaccaḥ puggalaḥ ārāmam gantā hoti abhikkhaṇam bhikkhūnam santike dhamma ssavaṇāya
translated: It’s a person who often goes to the monastery to listen to the Dhamma from the monks in the presence of the monks.

original: Tassa bhikkhū dhammaṁ desenti ādikalyāṇaṁ majjhekalyāṇaṁ pariyosānakalyāṇaṁ sātthaṁ sabyañjanaṁ kevalaparipuṇṇaṁ parisuddhaṁ brahmacariyaṁ pakāsenti.
analyzed: tassa bhikkhū dhammaṃ desenti ādi kalyāṇam majjhe kalyāṇam pariyosāna kalyāṇam sa attham sa byañjanam kevala paripuṇṇam parisuddham brahmacariyam pakāsenti
translated: The monks teach him the Dhamma good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, with the right meaning and phrasing, and they reveal the holy life that is utterly perfect and pure.

original: So tasmiṁ āsane nisinno tassā kathāya ādimpi manasi karoti, majjhampi manasi karoti, pariyosānampi manasi karoti.
analyzed: saḥ tasmin āsane nisinnaḥ tassā kathāya ādim pi manasi karoti majjham pi manasi karoti pariyosānam pi manasi karoti
translated: While sitting in that seat, he pays attention to the beginning, the middle, and the end of that talk.

original: Vuṭṭhito ca kho tamhā āsanā tassā kathāya neva ādiṁ manasi karoti, na majjhaṁ manasi karoti, na pariyosānaṁ manasi karoti.
analyzed: vuṭṭhitaḥ ca kho tamhā āsanā tassā kathāya na iva ādim manasi karoti na majjham manasi karoti na pariyosānam manasi karoti
translated: But when he gets up from his seat, he doesn’t pay attention to the beginning, the middle, or the end of that talk.

original: Seyyathāpi nāma purisassa ucchaṅge nānākhajjakāni ākiṇṇāni—
analyzed: seyyathā api nāma purisassa ucchaṅge nānā ākhajjakāni ākiṇṇāni
translated: It’s like a man who has various kinds of food and drink on his lap:

original: tilā taṇḍulā modakā badarā.
analyzed: tilā taṇḍulāḥ modakāḥ badarā
translated: sesame seeds, rice, cakes, and jujubes.

original: So tamhā āsanā vuṭṭhahanto satisammosā pakireyya;
analyzed: saḥ tamhā āsanā vuṭṭhahantaḥ sati sammosā pakireyya
translated: When he gets up from his seat, he drops them out of absentmindedness.

original: evamevaṁ idhekacco puggalo ārāmaṁ gantā hoti abhikkhaṇaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ santike dhammassavaṇāya.
analyzed: evam evam idha ekaccaḥ puggalaḥ ārāmam gantā hoti abhikkhaṇam bhikkhūnam santike dhamma ssavaṇāya
translated: In the same way, there is the person who goes to the monastery to listen to the Teaching in the presence of the monks.

original: Tassa bhikkhū dhammaṁ desenti ādikalyāṇaṁ majjhekalyāṇaṁ pariyosānakalyāṇaṁ sātthaṁ sabyañjanaṁ kevalaparipuṇṇaṁ parisuddhaṁ brahmacariyaṁ pakāsenti.
analyzed: tassa bhikkhū dhammaṃ desenti ādi kalyāṇam majjhe kalyāṇam pariyosāna kalyāṇam sa attham sa byañjanam kevala paripuṇṇam parisuddham brahmacariyam pakāsenti
translated: The monks teach him the Dhamma that is good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, with the right meaning and phrasing, and reveals a holy life that is utterly perfect and pure.

original: So tasmiṁ āsane nisinno tassā kathāya ādimpi manasi karoti, majjhampi manasi karoti, pariyosānampi manasi karoti.
analyzed: saḥ tasmin āsane nisinnaḥ tassā kathāya ādim pi manasi karoti majjham pi manasi karoti pariyosānam pi manasi karoti
translated: While sitting in that seat, he pays attention to the beginning, the middle, and the end of that talk.

original: Vuṭṭhito ca kho tamhā āsanā tassā kathāya neva ādimpi manasi karoti, na majjhampi manasi karoti, na pariyosānampi manasi karoti—

analyzed: seyyathā api tam kāsikavattham sukha samphassa tathūpamaḥ ayam puggalo
translated: This person is like Kāsi cloth of the finest quality.

original: Yesaṁ kho pana so paṭiggaṇhāti cīvarapiṇḍapātasenāsanagilānapaccayabhesajjaparikkhāraṁ, tesaṁ taṁ mahapphalaṁ hoti mahānisaṁsaṁ.
analyzed: yesam kho pana saḥ paṭiggaṇhāti cīvara piṇḍapāta senāsana gilāna paccaya bhesajja parikkhāra tesam tam mahapphalam hoti mahā nisasa
translated: Those who receive from him robes, alms-food, lodgings, and medicinal requisites for curing the sick will find it very fruitful and beneficial.

original: Idamassa mahagghatāya.
analyzed: idam assa mahat hatāya
translated: This is his high price.

original: Seyyathāpi taṁ kāsikavatthaṁ mahagghaṁ, tathūpamo ayaṁ puggalo.🔽Majjhimo cepi bhikkhu …pe…
analyzed: seyyathā api tam kāsikavattham mahaggha tathūpamaḥ ayam puggalaḥ  majjhimaḥ ce pi bhikkhu pe
translated: This person is like Kāsi cloth of the finest quality.

original: thero cepi bhikkhu hoti sīlavā kalyāṇadhammo, idamassa suvaṇṇatāya.
analyzed: thero ce pi bhikkhu hoti sīlavā kalyāṇa dhammo idam assa suvaṇṇa tāya
translated: Even if a monk is middle-aged, of little learning, and of poor presentation, but is virtuous and of good character, this is his beauty.🔽Even if a monk is senior, of little learning, and of poor presentation, but is virtuous and of good character, this is his beauty.

original: Seyyathāpi taṁ kāsikavatthaṁ vaṇṇavantaṁ, tathūpamo ayaṁ puggalo.
analyzed: seyyathā api tam kāsikavattham vaṇṇavanta tathūpamaḥ ayam puggalaḥ
translated: He is like the Kāsi cloth that is colorful.

original: Ye kho panassa sevanti bhajanti payirupāsanti diṭṭhānugatiṁ āpajjanti, tesaṁ taṁ hoti dīgharattaṁ hitāya sukhāya.
analyzed: ye kho pana assa sevanti bhajanti payirupāsanti diṭṭha anugatim āpajjanti tesam tam hoti dīgharattam hitāya sukhāya
translated: Those who associate with him, keep company with him, follow him, and pay homage to him will, for a long time, have what is wholesome and beneficial.

original: Idamassa sukhasamphassatāya.
analyzed: idam assa sukha samphassa tāya
translated: This is the quality of being pleasant to the touch.

original: Seyyathāpi taṁ kāsikavatthaṁ sukhasamphassaṁ, tathūpamo ayaṁ puggalo.🔽Yesaṁ kho pana so paṭiggaṇhāti cīvarapiṇḍapātasenāsanagilānapaccayabhesajjaparikkhāraṁ, tesaṁ taṁ mahapphalaṁ hoti mahānisaṁsaṁ.
analyzed: seyyathā api tam kāsikavattham sukha samphassa tathūpamaḥ ayam puggalo  yesam kho pana saḥ paṭiggaṇhāti cīvara piṇḍapāta senāsana gilāna paccaya bhesajja parikkhāra tesam tam mahapphalam hoti mahā nisasa
translated: He is like the Kāsi cloth that is pleasant to the touch.

original: Idamassa mahagghatāya.
analyzed: idam assa mahat hatāya
translated: Those who give him robes, almsfood, dwellings, and medicinal supplies will have great fruit and great reward.🔽This is the quality of being expensive.

original: Seyyathāpi taṁ kāsikavatthaṁ mahagghaṁ, tathūpamo ayaṁ puggalo.
analyzed: seyyathā api tam kāsikavattham mahaggha tathūpamaḥ ayam puggalaḥ
translated: He is like the Kāsi cloth that is expensive.

original: Evarūpo ce thero bhikkhu saṅghamajjhe bhaṇati, tamenaṁ bhikkhū evamāhaṁsu—
analyzed: evarūpaḥ ce theraḥ bhikkhu saṅgha majjhe bhaṇati tam enam bhikkhū evam āhasu
translated: If an elder monk speaks like this in the midst of the Sangha, the other monks say to him,

original: “appasaddā āyasmanto hotha, thero bhikkhu dhammañca vinayañca bhaṇatī”ti.
analyzed: appasaddāḥ āyasmantaḥ hotha theraḥ bhikkhu dhammañca vinayañca bhaṇati iti
translated: ‘Venerables, please be quiet. The elder monk is speaking about the Teaching and the Monastic Law.’

original: Tassa taṁ vacanaṁ ādheyyaṁ gacchati, gandhakaraṇḍakeva naṁ kāsikavatthaṁ.
analyzed: tassa tam vacanam ādheyyam gacchati gandha karaṇḍakā iva nam kāsikavattha
translated: His words are accepted as one would accept a piece of Kāsi cloth in a fragrant case.

original: Ime tayo kāsikavatthūpamā puggalā santo saṁvijjamānā bhikkhūsu.
analyzed: ime tayo kāsika vatthu upamā puggalā santaḥ savijjamānā bhikkhūsu
translated: These are the three kinds of people comparable to pieces of Kāsi cloth found among the bhikkhus.

original: Katamo ca puggalo suppameyyo?
analyzed: katamaḥ ca puggalo suppameyyaḥ
translated: “What kind of person is easy to admonish?

original: Idhekacco puggalo uddhato hoti unnaḷo capalo mukharo vikiṇṇavāco muṭṭhassati asampajāno asamāhito vibbhantacitto pākaṭindriyo—
analyzed: idha ekaccaḥ puggalaḥ uddhataḥ hoti unnaḷaḥ capalaḥ mukharaḥ vikiṇṇa vācaḥ muṭṭhaḥ sati asampajānaḥ asamāhitaḥ vibbhanta cittaḥ pākaṭindriyaḥ
translated: Here someone is restless, puffed up, personally vain, talkative, rambling in his talk, unmindful, not fully aware, unconcentrated, with a wandering mind, loose in his faculties.

original: ayaṁ vuccati puggalo “suppameyyo”.
analyzed: ayam vuccati puggalo suppameyyaḥ
translated: This kind of person is called ‘easy to admonish.’

original: Katamo ca puggalo duppameyyo?
analyzed: katamaḥ ca puggalaḥ duppameyyaḥ
translated: “What kind of person is difficult to admonish?

original: Idhekacco puggalo anuddhato hoti anunnaḷo acapalo amukharo avikiṇṇavāco upaṭṭhitassati sampajāno samāhito ekaggacitto saṁvutindriyo—
analyzed: idha ekaccaḥ puggalaḥ anuddhataḥ hoti an unnaḷaḥ a capalaḥ a mukharaḥ a vikiṇṇa vācaḥ upaṭṭhitaḥ sati sampajānaḥ samāhitaḥ ekagga cittaḥ savuti indriyo
translated: Here someone is not restless, not puffed up, personally modest, not talkative, not rambling in his talk, mindful, fully aware, concentrated, with a unified mind, restrained in his faculties.

original: ayaṁ vuccati puggalo “duppameyyo”.
analyzed: ayam vuccati puggalaḥ duppameyyaḥ
translated: This kind of person is called ‘difficult to admonish.’

original: Katamo ca puggalo appameyyo?
analyzed: katamaḥ ca puggalaḥ appameyyaḥ
translated: “What kind of person is immeasurable?

original: Idhekacco puggalo āsavānaṁ khayā anāsavaṁ cetovimuttiṁ paññāvimuttiṁ diṭṭheva dhamme sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharati—
analyzed: idha ekaccaḥ puggalaḥ āsavānam khayā anāsavam cetaḥ vimuttim paññā vimuttim diṭṭhe iva dhamme sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharati
translated: Here someone, by the destruction of the taints, in this very life enters and dwells in the taintless liberation of mind, liberation by wisdom, realizing it for himself with direct knowledge.

original: ayaṁ vuccati puggalo “appameyyo”.
analyzed: ayam vuccati puggalaḥ appameyyaḥ
translated: This is called an immeasurable person.

original: Katamo ca puggalo na sevitabbo na bhajitabbo na payirupāsitabbo?
analyzed: katamaḥ ca puggalaḥ na sevitabbaḥ na bhajitabbaḥ na payirupāsitabbaḥ
translated: “Who is the person you shouldn’t follow and attend on?

original: Idhekacco puggalo hīno hoti sīlena samādhinā paññāya.
analyzed: idha ekaccaḥ puggalo hīnaḥ hoti sīlena samādhinā paññāya
translated: It’s a person who is inferior in terms of virtue, concentration, and wisdom.

original: Evarūpo puggalo na sevitabbo na bhajitabbo na payirupāsitabbo, aññatra anuddayā aññatra anukampā.
analyzed: evarūpaḥ puggalaḥ na sevitabbaḥ na bhajitabbaḥ na payirupāsitabbaḥ aññatra anuddayā aññatra anukampā
translated: You shouldn’t follow and attend on such a person, except for the sake of courtesy and compassion.

original: Katamo ca puggalo sevitabbo bhajitabbo payirupāsitabbo?
analyzed: katamaḥ ca puggalaḥ sevitabbaḥ bhajitabbaḥ payirupāsitabbaḥ
translated: “Who is the person you should follow and attend on?

original: Idhekacco puggalo sadiso hoti sīlena samādhinā paññāya.
analyzed: idha ekaccaḥ puggalo sadisaḥ hoti sīlena samādhinā paññāya
translated: It’s a person who is similar in terms of virtue, concentration, and wisdom.

original: Evarūpo puggalo sevitabbo bhajitabbo payirupāsitabbo.
analyzed: evarūpaḥ puggalo sevitabbaḥ bhajitabbaḥ payirupāsitabbaḥ
translated: You should follow and attend on such a person.

original: Taṁ kissa hetu?
analyzed: tam kim sa hetu
translated: Why is that?

original: “Sīlasāmaññagatānaṁ sataṁ sīlakathā ca no bhavissati, sā ca no phāsu bhavissati, sā ca no pavattinī bhavissati;
analyzed: sīla sāmañña gatānam satam sīla kathā ca no bhavissati sā ca no phāsu bhavissati sā ca no pavattinī bhavissati
translated: “When we have the same virtue, we can discuss virtue, and that will be comfortable and productive for us.

original: samādhisāmaññagatānaṁ sataṁ samādhikathā ca no bhavissati, sā ca no phāsu bhavissati, sā ca no pavattinī bhavissati;
analyzed: samādhi sāmañña gatānam satam samādhi kathā ca no bhavissati sā ca no phāsu bhavissati sā ca no pavattinī bhavissati
translated: When we have the same concentration, we can discuss concentration, and that will be comfortable and productive for us.

original: paññāsāmaññagatānaṁ sataṁ paññākathā ca no bhavissati, sā ca no phāsu bhavissati, sā ca no pavattinī bhavissatī”ti.
analyzed: paññā sāmañña gatānam satam paññā kathā ca no bhavissati sā ca no phāsu bhavissati sā ca no pavattinī bhavissati iti
translated: We’ll have discussions about discernment with those who have discernment, and that will be our comfort and our pursuit.”

original: Tasmā evarūpo puggalo sevitabbo bhajitabbo payirupāsitabbo.
analyzed: tasmai evarūpaḥ puggalo sevitabbaḥ bhajitabbaḥ payirupāsitabbaḥ
translated: So you should attend on a person like this, wait on him, and honor him.

original: Katamo ca puggalo sakkatvā garuṁ katvā sevitabbo bhajitabbo payirupāsitabbo?
analyzed: katamaḥ ca puggalo sakkatvā garum katvā sevitabbaḥ bhajitabbaḥ payirupāsitabbaḥ
translated: “And what kind of person should you attend on, wait on, and honor, having shown him respect and esteem?

original: Idhekacco puggalo adhiko hoti sīlena samādhinā paññāya.
analyzed: idha ekaccaḥ puggalo adhikaḥ hoti sīlena samādhinā paññāya
translated: There is the case where a person is superior in virtue, concentration, and discernment.

original: Evarūpo puggalo sakkatvā garuṁ katvā sevitabbo bhajitabbo payirupāsitabbo.
analyzed: evarūpaḥ puggalo sakkatvā garum katvā sevitabbaḥ bhajitabbaḥ payirupāsitabbaḥ
translated: You should attend on a person like this, wait on him, and honor him, having shown him respect and esteem.

original: Taṁ kissa hetu?🔽“Aparipūraṁ vā sīlakkhandhaṁ paripūressāmi, paripūraṁ vā sīlakkhandhaṁ tattha tattha paññāya anuggahessāmi;
analyzed: tam kim sa hetu  a paripūram vā sīla kkhandham paripūressāmi paripūram vā sīla kkhandham tattha tattha paññāya anuggahessāmi
translated: And why is that?🔽“‘I will perfect the aggregate of virtue that I have not yet perfected, or, having already perfected it, I will maintain it.

original: aparipūraṁ vā samādhikkhandhaṁ paripūressāmi, paripūraṁ vā samādhikkhandhaṁ tattha tattha paññāya anuggahessāmi;
analyzed: aparipūram vā samādhi kkhandham paripūressāmi paripūram vā samādhi kkhandham tattha tattha paññāya anuggahessāmi
translated: I will perfect the aggregate of concentration that I have not yet perfected, or, having already perfected it, I will maintain it.

original: aparipūraṁ vā paññākkhandhaṁ paripūressāmi, paripūraṁ vā paññākkhandhaṁ tattha tattha paññāya anuggahessāmī”ti.
analyzed: a paripūram vā paññā kkhandham paripūressāmi paripūram vā paññā kkhandham tattha tattha paññāya anuggahessāmi iti
translated: I will perfect the knowledge and vision of liberation aggregate.’

original: Tasmā evarūpo puggalo sakkatvā garuṁ katvā sevitabbo bhajitabbo payirupāsitabbo.
analyzed: tasmai evarūpaḥ puggalo sakkatvā garum katvā sevitabbaḥ bhajitabbaḥ payirupāsitabbaḥ
translated: So you should serve and respect such a person.

original: Katamo ca puggalo jigucchitabbo na sevitabbo na bhajitabbo na payirupāsitabbo?
analyzed: katamaḥ ca puggalaḥ jigucchitabbaḥ na sevitabbaḥ na bhajitabbaḥ na payirupāsitabbaḥ
translated: “And what sort of person should be despised, not served or respected?

original: Idhekacco puggalo dussīlo hoti pāpadhammo asuci saṅkassarasamācāro paṭicchannakammanto assamaṇo samaṇapaṭiñño abrahmacārī brahmacāripaṭiñño antopūti avassuto kasambujāto.
analyzed: idha ekaccaḥ puggalaḥ dussīlaḥ hoti pāpa dhammaḥ asuci saṅkassara samācāraḥ paṭicchanna kammantaḥ a ssamaṇaḥ samaṇa paṭiññaḥ abrahmacārī brahmacāri paṭiññaḥ antopūti avassutaḥ kasambu jātaḥ
translated: There is the case where a person is unskillful, of deficient virtue, defiled, of impure character, concealing his faults, not revealing them, devoid of conscience, beyond the scope of restraint.

original: Evarūpo puggalo jigucchitabbo na sevitabbo na bhajitabbo na payirupāsitabbo.
analyzed: evarūpaḥ puggalaḥ jigucchitabbaḥ na sevitabbaḥ na bhajitabbaḥ na payirupāsitabbaḥ
translated: Such a person should be despised, not served or respected.

original: Taṁ kissa hetu?
analyzed: tam kim sa hetu
translated: Why is that?

original: Kiñcāpi evarūpassa puggalassa na diṭṭhānugatiṁ āpajjati, atha kho naṁ pāpako kittisaddo abbhuggacchati—
analyzed: kiñca api evarūpassa puggalassa na diṭṭhānugatim āpajjati atha kho nam pāpakaḥ kitti saddaḥ abbhuggacchati
translated: Even though one might not follow the example of such a person, still a bad report goes round,

original: “pāpamitto purisapuggalo pāpasahāyo pāpasampavaṅko”ti.
analyzed: pāpa mittaḥ purisa puggalaḥ pāpa sahāyaḥ pāpa sampavaṅkaḥ ti
translated: ‘That person is a bad friend, a bad companion, a bad adviser, for he is a bad person, of bad character.’

original: Seyyathāpi nāma ahi gūthagato kiñcāpi na ḍaṁsati, atha kho naṁ makkheti;
analyzed: seyyathā api nāma ahi gūtha gataḥ kiñca api na ḍasati atha kho nam makkheti
translated: Just as a snake, though not bitten, is still poisonous,

original: evamevaṁ kiñcāpi evarūpassa puggalassa na diṭṭhānugatiṁ āpajjati, atha kho naṁ pāpako kittisaddo abbhuggacchati—
analyzed: evam evam kiñca api evarūpassa puggalassa na diṭṭhānugatim āpajjati atha kho nam pāpakaḥ kitti saddaḥ abbhuggacchati
translated: so too, though one may not follow the example of such a person, still a bad report goes round,

original: “pāpamitto purisapuggalo pāpasahāyo pāpasampavaṅko”ti.
analyzed: pāpa mittaḥ purisa puggalaḥ pāpa sahāyaḥ pāpa sampavaṅkaḥ ti
translated: saying: ‘That person has bad friends, bad companions, bad comrades.’

original: Tasmā evarūpo puggalo jigucchitabbo na sevitabbo na bhajitabbo na payirupāsitabbo.
analyzed: tasmai evarūpaḥ puggalaḥ jigucchitabbaḥ na sevitabbaḥ na bhajitabbaḥ na payirupāsitabbaḥ
translated: So such a person should be despised, not associated with, not frequented, not honored.

original: Katamo ca puggalo ajjhupekkhitabbo na sevitabbo na bhajitabbo na payirupāsitabbo?
analyzed: katamaḥ ca puggalaḥ ajjhupekkhitabbaḥ na sevitabbaḥ na bhajitabbaḥ na payirupāsitabbaḥ
translated: “And who is the person to be looked at askance, not to be associated with, not to be frequented, not to be honored?

original: Idhekacco puggalo kodhano hoti upāyāsabahulo, appampi vutto samāno abhisajjati kuppati byāpajjati patitthīyati, kopañca dosañca appaccayañca pātukaroti.
analyzed: idha ekaccaḥ puggalaḥ kodhanaḥ hoti upāyāsa bahulaḥ appampi vutto samānaḥ abhisajjati kuppati byāpajjati patitthīyati kopam ca dosañca appaccayañca pātukaroti
translated: There is the case where a person is angry & hostile. He is overcome by anger. He is spoken to offensively, but he does not offend in return.

original: Seyyathāpi nāma duṭṭhāruko kaṭṭhena vā kaṭhalāya vā ghaṭṭito bhiyyoso mattāya āsavaṁ
analyzed: seyyathā api nāma duṭṭha ārukaḥ kaṭṭhena vā kaṭhalāya vā ghaṭṭitaḥ bhiyyosaḥ mattāya āsava
translated: Just as a rotten tooth, when struck by a toothpick,

original: deti, evamevaṁ idhekacco puggalo kodhano hoti upāyāsabahulo, appampi vutto samāno
analyzed: deti evam evam idha ekaccaḥ puggalaḥ kodhanaḥ hoti upāyāsa bahulaḥ appam pi vuttaḥ samāno
translated: so too is this person angry and often upset, and when spoken to even a little he

original: abhisajjati kuppati byāpajjati patitthīyati, kopañca dosañca appaccayañca pātukaroti.
analyzed: abhisajjati kuppati byāpajjati patitthīyati kopañca dosañca appaccayañca pātukaroti
translated: gets angry, bitter, and resentful, and shows anger, hate, and bitterness.

original: Seyyathāpi nāma tindukālātaṁ kaṭṭhena vā kaṭhalāya vā ghaṭṭitaṁ bhiyyoso mattāya cicciṭāyati ciṭiciṭāyati;
analyzed: sa iyyathā api nāma tinduka alātam kaṭṭhena vā kaṭhalāya vā ghaṭṭitam bhiyyosaḥ mattāya cicciṭāyati ciṭiciṭāyati
translated: Just as a dung beetle, when struck with a stick or a clod, rolls up its dung and stays put,

original: evamevaṁ idhekacco puggalo kodhano hoti upāyāsabahulo, appampi vutto samāno abhisajjati kuppati byāpajjati patitthīyati, kopañca dosañca appaccayañca pātukaroti.
analyzed: evam evam idha ekaccaḥ puggalaḥ kodhanaḥ hoti upāyāsa bahulaḥ vutto samānaḥ abhisajjati kuppati byāpajjati patitthīyati kopam ca dosañca appaccayañca pātukaroti
translated: so too is this person angry and often upset, and when spoken to even a little he gets angry, bitter, and resentful, and shows anger, hate, and bitterness.

original: Seyyathāpi nāma gūthakūpo kaṭṭhena vā kaṭhalāya vā ghaṭṭito bhiyyoso mattāya duggandho hoti;
analyzed: seyyathā api nāma gūtha kūpaḥ kaṭṭhena vā kaṭhalāya vā ghaṭṭitaḥ bhiyyosaḥ mattāya duggandhaḥ hoti
translated: Just as a cesspit, when struck with a stick or a clod, emits an even worse stench,

original: evamevaṁ idhekacco puggalo kodhano hoti upāyāsabahulo, appampi vutto samāno abhisajjati kuppati byāpajjati patitthīyati, kopañca dosañca appaccayañca pātukaroti;
analyzed: evam evam idha ekaccaḥ puggalaḥ kodhanaḥ hoti upāyāsa bahulaḥ vutto samānaḥ abhisajjati kuppati byāpajjati patitthīyati kopam ca dosañca appaccayañca pātukaroti
translated: so too is this person angry and often upset, and when spoken to even a little he gets angry, bitter, and resentful, and shows anger, hate, and bitterness.

original: evarūpo puggalo ajjhupekkhitabbo na sevitabbo na bhajitabbo na payirupāsitabbo.
analyzed: evarūpaḥ puggalaḥ ajjhupekkhitabbaḥ na sevitabbaḥ na bhajitabbaḥ na payirupāsitabbaḥ
translated: You should ignore such a person. You shouldn’t associate with them, visit them, or attend on them.

original: Taṁ kissa hetu?
analyzed: tam kim sa hetu
translated: Why is that?

original: “Akkoseyyapi maṁ paribhāseyyapi maṁ anatthampi me kareyyā”ti.
analyzed: akkoseyya api mam paribhāseyya api mam anattham pi me kareyya ati
translated: “They might abuse me, insult me, threaten me, or do me harm.”

original: Tasmā evarūpo puggalo ajjhupekkhitabbo na sevitabbo na bhajitabbo na payirupāsitabbo.
analyzed: tasmai evarūpaḥ puggalaḥ ajjhupekkhitabbaḥ na sevitabbaḥ na bhajitabbaḥ na payirupāsitabbaḥ
translated: That’s why you should ignore such a person. You shouldn’t associate with them, visit them, or attend on them.

original: Katamo ca puggalo sevitabbo bhajitabbo payirupāsitabbo?
analyzed: katamaḥ ca puggalaḥ sevitabbaḥ bhajitabbaḥ payirupāsitabbaḥ
translated: “And who is the person you should associate with, visit, and attend on?

original: Idhekacco puggalo sīlavā hoti kalyāṇadhammo—
analyzed: idha ekaccaḥ puggalo sīlavā hoti kalyāṇa dhammo
translated: It’s a person who is ethical, of good character.

original: evarūpo puggalo sevitabbo bhajitabbo payirupāsitabbo.
analyzed: evarūpaḥ puggalo sevitabbaḥ bhajitabbaḥ payirupāsitabbaḥ
translated: You should associate with, visit, and attend on such a person.

original: Taṁ kissa hetu?
analyzed: tam kim sa hetu
translated: Why is that?

original: Kiñcāpi evarūpassa puggalassa na diṭṭhānugatiṁ āpajjati, atha kho naṁ kalyāṇo kittisaddo abbhuggacchati—
analyzed: kiñca api evarūpassa puggalassa na diṭṭhānugatim āpajjati atha kho nam kalyāṇaḥ kitti saddaḥ abbhuggacchati
translated: Even if you don’t follow the example of such a person, you still get a good reputation:

original: “kalyāṇamitto purisapuggalo kalyāṇasahāyo kalyāṇasampavaṅko”ti.
analyzed: kalyāṇa mittaḥ purisa puggalaḥ kalyāṇa sahāyaḥ kalyāṇa sampavaṅko ti
translated: ‘This person has good friends, good companions, good comrades.’

original: Tasmā evarūpo puggalo sevitabbo bhajitabbo payirupāsitabbo.
analyzed: tasmai evarūpaḥ puggalo sevitabbaḥ bhajitabbaḥ payirupāsitabbaḥ
translated: That’s why you should associate with, visit, and attend on such a person.”🔽“And who is the person you shouldn’t associate with, visit, or attend on?

original: Katamo ca puggalo sīlesu paripūrakārī, samādhismiṁ mattaso kārī, paññāya mattaso kārī?
analyzed: katamaḥ ca puggalo sīlesu paripūra kārī samādhismim mattaso kārī paññāya mattaso kārī
translated: And what kind of person has fulfilled virtue, fulfilled concentration, but only a measure of wisdom?

original: Sotāpannasakadāgāmino—
analyzed: sotāpanna sakadāgāminaḥ
translated: Stream-enterers and once-returners.

original: ime vuccanti puggalā sīlesu paripūrakārino, samādhismiṁ mattaso kārino, paññāya mattaso kārino.
analyzed: ime vuccanti puggalā sīlesu paripūra kārinaḥ samādhismim mattaso kārinaḥ paññāya mattaso kārinaḥ
translated: These are called the kind of people who have fulfilled virtue, fulfilled concentration, but only a measure of wisdom.

original: Katamo ca puggalo sīlesu ca paripūrakārī, samādhismiñca paripūrakārī, paññāya mattaso kārī?
analyzed: katamo ca puggalo sīlesu ca paripūra kārī samādhismiñca paripūra kārī paññāya mattasaḥ kārī
translated: And what kind of person has fulfilled virtue and concentration, but only a measure of wisdom?

original: Anāgāmī—
analyzed: anāgāmī
translated: Non-returners.

original: ayaṁ vuccati puggalo sīlesu ca paripūrakārī, samādhismiñca paripūrakārī, paññāya mattaso kārī.
analyzed: ayam vuccati puggalo sīlesu ca paripūra kārī samādhismin ca paripūra kārī paññāya kārī
translated: This is called the kind of person who has fulfilled virtue and concentration, but only a measure of wisdom.

original: Katamo ca puggalo sīlesu ca paripūrakārī, samādhismiñca paripūrakārī, paññāya ca paripūrakārī?
analyzed: katamaḥ ca puggalo sīlesu ca paripūra kārī samādhismiñca paripūra kārī paññāya ca paripūra kārī
translated: And what kind of person has fulfilled virtue, concentration, and wisdom?

original: Arahā—
analyzed: arahā
translated: A perfected one.

original: ayaṁ vuccati puggalo sīlesu ca paripūrakārī, samādhismiñca paripūrakārī, paññāya ca paripūrakārī.
analyzed: ayam vuccati puggalo sīlesu ca paripūra kārī samādhismin ca paripūra kārī paññāya ca paripūra kārī
translated: This is called the kind of person who has fulfilled virtue, concentration, and wisdom.

original: Tattha katame tayo satthāro?
analyzed: tattha katame tayo satthāro
translated: Herein, what are the three teachers?

original: Idhekacco satthā kāmānaṁ pariññaṁ paññapeti, na rūpānaṁ pariññaṁ paññapeti, na vedanānaṁ pariññaṁ paññapeti.
analyzed: idha ekaccaḥ satthā kāmānam pariññam paññapeti na rūpānam pariññam paññapeti na vedanānam pariññam paññapeti
translated: Herein, a certain teacher describes the full understanding of sensual-desire element, but does not describe the full understanding of the form element and the feeling element.

original: Idha panekacco satthā kāmānañca pariññaṁ paññapeti, rūpānañca pariññaṁ paññapeti, na vedanānaṁ pariññaṁ paññapeti.
analyzed: idha pana ekaccaḥ satthā kāmānam ca pariññam paññapeti rūpānam ca pariññam paññapeti na vedanānam pariññam paññapeti
translated: Herein, a certain teacher describes the full understanding of the sensual-desire element and the form element, but does not describe the full understanding of the feeling element.

original: Idha panekacco satthā kāmānañca pariññaṁ paññapeti, rūpānañca pariññaṁ paññapeti, vedanānañca pariññaṁ paññapeti.🔽Tatra yvāyaṁ satthā kāmānaṁ pariññaṁ paññapeti, na rūpānaṁ pariññaṁ paññapeti, na vedanānaṁ pariññaṁ paññapeti, rūpāvacarasamāpattiyā lābhī satthā tena daṭṭhabbo.
analyzed: idha pana ekaccaḥ satthā kāmānam ca pariññam paññapeti rūpānam ca pariññam paññapeti vedanānam ca pariññam paññapeti  tatra yvā ayam satthā kāmānam pariññam paññapeti na rūpānam pariññam paññapeti na vedanānam pariññam paññapeti rūpāvacara samāpattiyāḥ lābhī satthā tena daṭṭhabbo
translated: Herein, a certain teacher describes the full understanding of the sensual-desire element and the form element and the feeling element.🔽Herein, the teacher who describes the full understanding of the sensual-desire element, but does not describe the full understanding of the form element and the feeling element, should be regarded as a teacher who has attained the form-sphere attainment.

original: Tatra yvāyaṁ satthā kāmānañca pariññaṁ paññapeti, rūpānañca pariññaṁ paññapeti, na vedanānaṁ pariññaṁ paññapeti, arūpāvacarasamāpattiyā lābhī satthā tena daṭṭhabbo.
analyzed: tatra yvā ayam satthā kāmānam ca pariññam paññapeti rūpānam ca pariññam paññapeti na vedanānam pariññam paññapeti arūpāvacara samāpattiyāḥ lābhī satthā tena daṭṭhabbo
translated: Herein, the teacher who describes the full understanding of the sensual-desire element and the form element, but does not describe the full understanding of the feeling element, should be regarded as a teacher who has attained the formless-sphere attainment.

original: Tatra yvāyaṁ satthā kāmānañca pariññaṁ paññapeti, rūpānañca pariññaṁ paññapeti, vedanānañca pariññaṁ paññapeti, sammāsambuddho satthā tena daṭṭhabbo.
analyzed: tatra yvā ayam satthā kāmānam ca pariññam paññapeti rūpānam ca pariññam paññapeti vedanānam ca pariññam paññapeti sammāsambuddhaḥ satthā tena daṭṭhabbaḥ
translated: Herein, the Teacher who reveals the full understanding of sensual desires, the full understanding of forms, and the full understanding of feelings is the Teacher who is fully enlightened.

original: Ime tayo satthāro.
analyzed: ime tayo satthāro
translated: These are the three kinds of teachers.

original: Tattha katame aparepi tayo satthāro?🔽Idhekacco satthā diṭṭhe ceva dhamme attānaṁ saccato thetato paññapeti, abhisamparāyañca attānaṁ saccato thetato paññapeti.🔽Idha panekacco satthā diṭṭhe ceva dhamme attānaṁ saccato thetato paññapeti, no ca kho abhisamparāyaṁ attānaṁ saccato thetato paññapeti.
analyzed: tattha katame apare pi tayo satthāro  idha ekaccaḥ satthā diṭṭhe ca iva dhamme attānam saccataḥ thetataḥ paññapeti abhisamparāyañca attānam saccataḥ thetataḥ paññapeti  idha pana ekaccaḥ satthā diṭṭhe ca iva dhamme attānam saccatas thetatas paññapeti no ca kho abhisamparāyam attānam saccatas thetatas paññapeti
translated: Herein, what are the other three kinds of teachers?🔽Here a certain teacher proclaims himself in the here and now to be perfected in self-control and peace, and he proclaims that after death he will exist in a form that is subtle and immaterial.🔽Here a certain teacher proclaims himself in the here and now to be perfected in self-control and peace, but he does not proclaim that after death he will exist in a form that is subtle and immaterial.

original: Idha panekacco satthā diṭṭhe ceva dhamme attānaṁ saccato thetato na paññapeti, abhisamparāyañca attānaṁ saccato thetato na paññapeti.
analyzed: idha pana ekaccaḥ satthā diṭṭhe ca iva dhamme attānam saccatas thetatas na paññapeti abhisamparāyañca attānam saccatas thetatas na paññapeti
translated: Here a certain teacher does not proclaim himself in the here and now to be perfected in self-control and peace, nor does he proclaim that after death he will exist in a form that is subtle and immaterial.

original: Tatra yvāyaṁ satthā diṭṭhe ceva dhamme attānaṁ saccato thetato paññapeti, abhisamparāyañca attānaṁ saccato thetato paññapeti, sassatavādo satthā tena daṭṭhabbo.🔽Tatra yvāyaṁ satthā diṭṭhe ceva dhamme attānaṁ saccato thetato paññapeti, no ca kho abhisamparāyaṁ attānaṁ saccato thetato paññapeti, ucchedavādo satthā tena daṭṭhabbo.
analyzed: tatra yvā ayam satthā diṭṭhe ca iva dhamme attānam saccatas thetatas paññapeti abhisamparāyañca attānam saccatas thetatas paññapeti sassata vādaḥ satthā tena daṭṭhabbo  tatra yvā ayam satthā diṭṭhe ca iva dhamme attānam saccataḥ thetataḥ paññapeti no ca kho abhisamparāyam attānam saccataḥ thetataḥ paññapeti uccheda vādaḥ satthā tena daṭṭhabbo
translated: Herein, when a teacher describes himself in the here-and-now as real and true, and he describes himself in the life-to-come as real and true, then the teacher is to be regarded as an eternalist.🔽When a teacher describes himself in the here-and-now as real and true, but he does not describe himself in the life-to-come as real and true, then the teacher is to be regarded as an annihilationist.

original: Tatra yvāyaṁ satthā diṭṭhe ceva dhamme attānaṁ saccato thetato na paññapeti, abhisamparāyañca attānaṁ saccato thetato na paññapeti, sammāsambuddho satthā tena daṭṭhabbo.
analyzed: tatra yvā ayam satthā diṭṭhe ca iva dhamme attānam saccatas thetatas na paññapeti abhisamparāyañca attānam saccatas thetatas na paññapeti sammāsambuddhaḥ satthā tena daṭṭhabbaḥ
translated: When a teacher does not describe himself in the here-and-now as real and true, nor does he describe himself in the life-to-come as real and true, then the teacher is to be regarded as a Perfect One.

original: Ime aparepi tayo satthāro.🔽Tikaniddeso.
analyzed: ime apare pi tayo satthāro 🔽tika niddesaḥ
translated: These are three other teachers.
